gaffer.serialisation

Interface Serialisation<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSerialisation, AvroSerialiser, BooleanSerialiser, CertificateVisibilitySerialiser, CompactRawIntegerSerialiser, CompactRawLongSerialiser, DateSerialiser, DoubleSerialiser, FloatSerialiser, FreqMapSerialiser, HyperLogLogPlusSerialiser, IntegerFreqMapSerialiser, IntegerSerialiser, JavaSerialiser, LongSerialiser, RawDateSerialiser, RawDoubleSerialiser, RawFloatSerialiser, RawIntegerSerialiser, RawLongSerialiser, StringSerialiser, TreeSetStringSerialiser, TypeSubTypeValueSerialiser, TypeValueSerialiser, VisibilitySerialiser

    public interface Serialisation<T>
extends Serializable
    Definition of what is required from a serialisation mechanism used by the Graph Store.

    As a minimum, any Serialisation mechanism must be able to serialise and deserialise any given Property.

      T deserialiseEmptyBytes()
      Handle an empty byte array and reconstruct an appropriate representation in Object form.
      boolean isByteOrderPreserved()

      Request that the Serialisation serialises some object and returns the raw bytes of the serialised form.
      byte[] serialiseNull()
      Handle an incoming null value and generate an appropriate byte array representation.

    • Method Detail

      • canHandle

        boolean canHandle(Class clazz)
        Enables checking whether the serialiser can serialise a particular class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the object class to serialise
        Returns:
        boolean true if it can be handled

      • serialise

        byte[] serialise(T object)
          throws SerialisationException
        Request that the Serialisation serialises some object and returns the raw bytes of the serialised form.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be serialised
        Returns:
        byte[] the serialised bytes
        Throws:
        SerialisationException - if the object fails to serialise

      • deserialise

        T deserialise(byte[] bytes)
       throws SerialisationException
        From a byte array representing the Serialised form of a Property we should reconstruct the Object.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the serialised bytes to deserialise
        Returns:
        T the deserialised object
        Throws:
        SerialisationException - if the object fails to deserialise

      • serialiseNull

        byte[] serialiseNull()
        Handle an incoming null value and generate an appropriate byte array representation.
        Returns:
        byte[] the serialised bytes

      • deserialiseEmptyBytes

        T deserialiseEmptyBytes()
        Handle an empty byte array and reconstruct an appropriate representation in Object form.
        Returns:
        T the deserialised object

      • isByteOrderPreserved

        boolean isByteOrderPreserved()
        Returns:
        true if the serialisation will preserve the order of bytes, otherwise false.
